title: Upper Yoke - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Note the routing of the brake hose and harnesses through the cable guides for installation.
Remove the three rubber bands securing the harnesses to the brake line.
Detach the handlebar harnesses from the cable guides on the electronic steering lock cover.
Release the fixing and remove the cable guides on the headstock. Discard the fixing (right hand side shown).
The right hand electrical connector housing is located behind the right hand radiator assembly.
The left hand electrical connector housing is located behind the right hand radiator assembly.
Note the routing of the active supension harness for installation.
Detach the front and lower ends of the rubber covers from the left and right hand electrical connector housings (right hand side shown).
Release the locking device and detach the electronic steering lock connector from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Disconnect the electronic steering lock connector from the main harness.
Disconnect the left and right hand front fork connector from the main harness.
Route the harnesses up to the upper yoke.
If the lower yoke fixings are also loosened, the forks will no longer support the weight of the motorcycle.
Do not loosen the lower yoke fixings as, in this condition, the motorcycle could topple over causing damage and/or risk of injury.
Loosen the upper yoke clamp fixings.

Care must be taken when removing the upper yoke centre nut, to make sure that the centre nut and upper yoke do not become scratched. Protect the surfaces with a suitable cloth or tape to prevent scratching.
Remove the upper yoke centre nut and washer.
Ease the upper yoke from the forks, feed the front fork cables through and remove from the motorcycle.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Perform the following operations:
Raise and support the front of the motorcycle.
Handlebars - Removal
Note the routing of the brake hose and harnesses through the cable guides for installation.
Remove the three rubber bands securing the harnesses to the brake line.

Centre rubber band
Lower rubber band
Detach the handlebar harnesses from the cable guides on the electronic steering lock cover.
Release the fixing and remove the cable guides on the headstock. Discard the fixing (right hand side shown).
Fixing
Cable guide
The right hand electrical connector housing is located behind the right hand radiator assembly.
The left hand electrical connector housing is located behind the right hand radiator assembly.
Note the routing of the active supension harness for installation.
Detach the front and lower ends of the rubber covers from the left and right hand electrical connector housings (right hand side shown).
Cover (radiator assembly removed for clarity)
Front retaining lug
Lower retaining lug
Release the locking device and detach the electronic steering lock connector from the left hand electrical connector housing.
Disconnect the electronic steering lock connector from the main harness.
Disconnect the left and right hand front fork connector from the main harness.
Route the harnesses up to the upper yoke.
Left hand fork connector
Right hand fork connector
Electronic steering lock connector
Locking device
Left electrical connector housing
If the lower yoke fixings are also loosened, the forks will no longer support the weight of the motorcycle.
Do not loosen the lower yoke fixings as, in this condition, the motorcycle could topple over causing damage and/or risk of injury.
Loosen the upper yoke clamp fixings.
Upper yoke upper fixing
Upper yoke lower fixing

Care must be taken when removing the upper yoke centre nut, to make sure that the centre nut and upper yoke do not become scratched. Protect the surfaces with a suitable cloth or tape to prevent scratching.
Remove the upper yoke centre nut and washer.
Upper yoke centre nut
Ease the upper yoke from the forks, feed the front fork cables through and remove from the motorcycle.
